subject: Re: [junit] this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource("/") is null
msgSnippet: What happens when you run your current test? David Saff
messageBody:
What happens when you run your current test?

David Saff

On Fri, Aug 6, 2010 at 5:44 AM, ajay <ajaytorgal@...> wrote:
> I am writing a Junit test for a class which has this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource("/") and returns null
>
> public ModelAndView urlGen(HttpServletRequest request,
>            HttpServletResponse response) throws ServletException, IOException {
>  private static final String SLASH = "/";
> public class UrlGenController extends MultiActionController {
>
>  URL path = this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource(SLASH);
> ....
> return null
> }
> }
> Please guide me to write unit test for this, my unit test is as follows
>
> public void testUrlGenerator() throws ServletException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
>                 Thread.currentThread().setContextClassLoader(ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader());
>                assertNull(m_UrlGeneratorController.urlGenerator(m_request, m_response));
> }
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
